content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "write_to_file" command to save a list of legal research resources to a file named "legal_research_resources.txt". The list includes the Harvard Law School Library guide on free legal research, the Texas State Law Library guide on legal research for beginners, George Mason University Law Library list of free legal research resources, Bloomberg Law's Complete Legal Research Resource, Clio's list of best free legal research tools, Alaska Court System's legal research page, United Nations' legal research guide, and LexisNexis's list of best free legal research tools. The command returned a message that the file was written successfully. I used the "google" command to search for the statute of limitations for personal injury in New York, and received a list of relevant links. I executed the "calculate_average" function from the "average.py" file and then ran a test using the "test_average.py" file, which returned the message "The average of the numbers is: 3.0". I used the "browse_website" command to search for the standard of proof in a personal injury case on the website "https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/personal_injury", but the website did not provide the information I was looking for.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "international law research resources"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://law.gwu.libguides.com/PIL", "https://uow.libguides.com/law/international-law-resources", "https://research.un.org/az.php?s=1520", "https://guides.library.harvard.edu/law/fi-free", "https://www.law.nyu.edu/global/researchtools", "https://www.loc.gov/research-centers/law-library-of-congress/collections/digital-collections/foreign-law/", "https://www.law.nyu.edu/library/research/researchguides", "https://libguides.law.rutgers.edu/internationallaw"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "average.py", "text": "def calculate_average(numbers):\\n    total = sum(numbers)\\n    count = len(numbers)\\n    average = total / count\\n    return average\\n\\nnumbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]\\naverage = calculate_average(numbers)\\nprint(\'The average of the numbers is:\', average)"}}}', type='ai_response')]
"""
